intro: Chomelia juruensis, commonly known as the Juruense chomelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Chomelia juruensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
